intro: Chrysorhoe nitens, commonly known as the white-flowered chrysorhoe, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Chrysorhoe nitens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
